Superb Amazing place! Probably one of the best were we’ve stayed. The room was just exceptional. Everything has been thought out to the last detail. Very comfortable and at the highest level. One thing that spoiled the whole experience of staying at this lovely hotel was the service of some of the staff. Unfortunately I made a mistake when booking and forgot to include breakfasts in our stay. During the check-in I asked the manager to add breakfasts and pay for them, to which I received the answer that it is not a problem, you pay a deposit, which allows you to attend breakfast and the money will be withdrawn from this account. I specifically asked about the best place to choose for breakfast and chose the restaurant by the pool on the 57th floor. What was our surprise when, instead of the breakfast sets offered, we were given the a la carte menu and informed that we could not get their breakfast sets that we were so eager to try. After that, when we informed the hotel manager about the situation - they didn't help us in any way, except apologizing. After that we went to their buffet where there were also a lot of strange things from the staff like bringing the bill during the meal, a few clarifications on what room we were in and communication problems during the ordering of hot drinks. 
Unfortunately these things completely ruined the great experience we had with this amazing place and most likely we will not choose this place for our next stay in Singapore.
room_type: Sands Premier King Gardens by the Bay View

Resplendent Marina Bay Sands - swimming in the clouds The location. the room. the pool, the staff. Marina Bay Sands is a place that everyone should stay at just once in their life. Save up, do whatever you have to. It is truly an amazing experience. We were made to feel amazing from the moment we were greeted at the door , to the moment we left. Nothing changed. The staff were exceptional. A big shout out to Patrick our check in concierge. He was stupendous. The infinity pool has to be swum in to be believed..especially at dawn and dusk. My advice, ask for a room with a garden view...OMG...the bay, the gardens at night. It simply is the best. The only thing that we were disappointed with was the mattress. It was simply too hard for our linking. Mattresses are the bain of most travellers - too hard, too soft. Hard to get right. But hey, we still slept pretty well, it wasn't that bad that we didn't sleep - we were, after all given a free upgrade before we even got to our room (Patrick liked us for some odd reason) You know the old addage - it doesn't cost anything to be nice!!!! Just saying people - treat the staff with dignity.

Most hotels in Singapore had really good room conditions and service, but Marina Bay Sands was by far the best! Cleanliness was basic and the room itself was very nice. Bathroom amenities were disposable Jo Malone products, the dryer was a Dyson product, and in addition, there was a bath bomb and a neck pillow that can be used while taking a half-body bath. The shower gown and slippers were so pretty that I loved them :) Not to mention the view. It was so cool without it! Personally, I was very satisfied with choosing the garden view because the city view was visible from the pool and didn't feel special. Breakfast and the food we ordered at the pool were so delicious! If you go to Singapore, I highly recommend staying at least one night.
room_type: Sands Premier Double Queen Gardens By The Bay View

Oh, that pool and the view... :) :) :) A room with armchairs and a desk, a large TV, a comfortable, large bed, and nice bedding, a bathroom with good toiletries, coffee, tea, and a mini-bar – basically everything you need in a hotel. A balcony, too. It's a real treat to be able to slide the windows open and sit on the balcony in the evening, admiring the garden and ships from the 36th floor. The staff are very friendly and helpful. During check-in, the lovely receptionists explained the rules ahead of time, even before I asked. I also received water because it was obvious I needed it. A nice gesture, thank you. I appreciated the organizational solutions – information about available rooms is sent via email, and thanks to Wi-Fi, you don't have to worry about mobile data. The queue management at the reception desk, very fast check-out, and the possibility of early check-in to wait for a room at the pool area. Those with large suitcases can leave them at the reception until their room is ready. Access to the pool, bars, and rooftop restaurant makes all the difference. Apparently there is renovation work going on in the 3rd tower - I didn't hear or see anything... :)

Fantastic session with Lisa! I had a 90-minute massage with Lisa and it ws honestly 1 of the best I’ve ever had. Right from the start, she made me feel at ease with her warm, professional approach and calming setup. Her technique struck the perfect balance between relaxing and genuinely therapeutic—she somehow knew exactly where the tension was and worked through it without me having to say much at all!

The pressure was spot on, and she checked in just enough to make sure I was comfortable. By the end of the session, I felt completely relaxed and could feel a big difference, especially in my back and shoulders. U can tell Lisa really knows her craft and puts genuine care into her work.

I’d highly recommend her if you’re looking for a massage that not only feels great but also really helps. I’m definitely coming back.

Great hotel Although I had booked a room with two queen beds without meals, they said there was one available, and they upgraded me to a king-bed suite. Breakfast was also included. The curtains automatically opened upon entering the room, Wi-Fi was available, and I was able to charge my phone by simply placing it on the bedside table—no cords needed. The receptionist spoke fluent Japanese, which was a relief, even though it was my first time in Singapore. I checked in in the evening, used the pool, had takeout food outside, and watched two shows, Gardens by the Bay and Spectra, making for a very satisfying stay. I stopped by the Merlion on my way out in the morning. It's a bit pricey, but the location and views are fantastic. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and it was very clean. We had a bit of trouble finding the elevator to the suite as none of the elevators would lead to it.

Exceptional You can't come to Singapore and not visit this massive, luxurious and famous accommodation.
So, we booked for 1 night, despite that even the normal room was very expensive. When we arrived at the check in counter, we got an upgrade to an amazing room, with stunning views on the 28 floor.
The main attraction of the hotel is of course the deck and the pool at the top. The pool is open until 11pm, which is pretty amazing, Singapore looks breathtaking from there at night. 
We really enjoyed our stay. It was only 1 night, but it was spot on. The design is a bit old, and also the price could be cheaper.
It's not so comfortable to reach the restaurants, the pool and the deck at the top. You had to switch elevators and sometimes even towers.
